Title: Improvement to the Bradford to Shipley Corridor
Description:
The Council is seeking to appoint an experienced transport modelling consultancy to work with the project team and support:
•	Development of a cordon transport model for the Bradford to Shipley Corridor Improvement Project based on the SATURN modelling platform.
•	Coordinate data collection exercise in relation to the cordon transport model development using Bradford's existing (dates) SATURN strategic Transport Model
•	Amend the existing strategic Saturn model to test WY+TF proposals for Bradford to Shipley Corridor Improvement Project including providing support and input to Outline Business Case preparation (in particular the strategic , economic and commercial cases).  Economic appraisal may require the use of appropriate modelling software such as COBA, TUBA and QUADRO.
•	Provide recommendations to the Project team including interventions that better meet the objectives within the projects scope and constraints
•	To provide all the necessary modelling work and outputs required in accordance with WebTAG and WYCA'S Transport Business Case requirements
•	To liaise with the project team

Title: ESPH SB Street Cleanliness Surveys (ESPH141) - AWARD
Description:
**This project has now been awarded**

The Rother District Council – Joint Waste Partnership (JWP) are seeking Contractors to provide a Street Cleansing Monitoring Service.  The Joint Waste Partnership comprises the Waste Collection Authorities of Eastbourne Borough Council, Hastings Borough Council, Rother District Council and Wealden District Council as well as the Disposal Authority East Sussex County Council.

During 2011 and 2012 JWP procured a contract for the provision of waste collection and street cleansing services.  The contract was awarded to Kier Environmental Services Ltd who now collects refuse and recycling from all domestic households as well as being responsible for street and beach cleansing across the JWP area.

The National Indicator (NI) 195 methodology was used as a way for local authorities to measure the local environmental quality of their streets in a structured way.  It also provided local authorities with important performance management information which allowed them to drive up service delivery by focusing resources on poorly performing areas of their service.  It is for these reasons the joint waste and recycling street and beach cleansing contract adopted the NI 195 survey methodology as a way of measuring contractor performance.

The objective of the work is to provide JWP with an accurate, independent view of the standards of street cleansing by adopting NI 195 survey in each of the four partner council areas.  It is anticipated that the successful contractor would be required to start surveying in August 2016.

Please see the full tender for more information.

Deadline for receipt of clarifications: 17.06.2016

Deadline for receipt of tenders: 01.07.2016

Organisation Name: Homes England (the name adopted by the Homes and Communities Agency)
Title: Homes England Asbestos Services in Buildings and Structures Framework
Description:
Our Asbestos Services in buildings and structures Framework will used by Homes England and also be made available to other public bodies as part of Homes England's enabling role which include central government departments and their arm's length bodies and agencies, non departmental public bodies, NHS bodies, local authorities, registered providers, health, police, fire and rescue, education, charities and devolved administrations.
Refer to our procurement documentation for further details.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Additional Text:
The opportunity can be accessed via Home England's e-Tendering system. Tenderers wishing to be considered for this contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through our e-Tendering system. If not already registered, candidates should register at https://procontract.due-north.com/Login
All discussions, meetings, and communications will be conducted in English.
The contract will be subject to English law. Tenders and all supporting documents must be priced in GBP and all payments under the contract will be made in GBP.
This procurement and award are subject to the transparency arrangements being adopted by the UK Government. These arrangements include the publication of tender documentation issued by Homes England and our contract with the supplier.
Bidders should highlight any areas they consider commercially sensitive in order for Homes England to be able to honour our transparency obligations without undermining the bidder's commercial interests.
Candidates are advised that Homes England is subject to the freedom of information Act 2000 ("The Act"). If a candidate considers that any of the information supplied as part of this procurement procedure should not be disclosed because of its commercial sensitivity, confidential or otherwise, they must, when providing this information, clearly identify the specific information they do not wish to be disclosed and clearly specify the reasons for its sensitivity. Homes England shall take such statements into consideration in the event that it receives a request pursuant to the act which relates to the information provided by the interested party. Please note, it is insufficient to include a statement of confidentiality encompassing all the information provided in the response.
Homes England takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption and sets high standards of impartiality, integrity and objectivity in relation to the stewardship of public funds and the management of its activities. The principles contained within this policy apply to both internal and external audiences, including anyone wishing to undertake business or engage with Homes England.
Please refer to our anti-bribery and corruption policy by visiting https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/anti-bribery-and-corruption-policy for further information.
Homes England (the trading name adopted by the Homes and Communities Agency) is committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal data. Details can be found at https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/homes-england/about/personal-information-charter
All dates in this notice are indicative and may be amended.
